definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Recently restaurants sell soups and drinks made from concentrate has brought into focus.
sentences.chinese: 近來，全城熱議餐廳使用濃縮液製作湯及飲料。

sentences.english: This realistic melodrama about urban people's emotional life became an instant hot topic among the audience.
sentences.chinese: 這部現實題材的都市情感劇一播出就引發觀衆的熱議。

sentences.english: This sentence has a time printing of a hot topic in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 這句話曾一時成爲日本坊間熱議的話題。

sentences.english: Radical feminism is currently the fashionable topic among the chattering classes.
sentences.chinese: 激進的女權主義是時下名嘴階層熱議的話題。

sentences.english: It has always been a hot topic whether collegians should go on study at a graduate school or just find a job when they graduate.
sentences.chinese: 畢業以後是選擇讀研還是找工作一直都被人們熱議。

sentences.english: It is the first step towards the inflation targeting that some economists have argued for.
sentences.chinese: 這是應對一些經濟學家已在熱議的通貨膨脹的第一步。

sentences.english: The "internationalization" of China's currency, the yuan, is again the topic du jour.
sentences.chinese: 人民幣“國際化”的話題又一次成爲“每日熱議”。

sentences.english: The move set off a media firestorm, particularly in the blogosphere.
sentences.chinese: 這一行動引起媒體熱議，尤其是在博客圈。

sentences.english: The question of compulsory sterilisation has been the subject of lively public debate over the last few months.
sentences.chinese: 強制絕育是過去幾個月裏公衆熱議的話題。

sentences.english: Goal setting seems to be a perennially hot topic!
sentences.chinese: 設定目標看起來是一個持續的熱議話題。

sentences.english: The Internets are abuzz about a brand new electric motorcycle, with good reason.
sentences.chinese: 網上正在熱議一款新的電動摩托車，還煞有其事。

to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
to bombard/to bomb/(fig.) to criticize/to roast
to ratchet up/to raise (expectations etc)/to increase (a quota, a position in the market etc)/to up the ante/(computing) to encode
could happen at any moment/on the verge
